subject: Travel
title: Buddhism Travels East
description: Learn Buddhism Travels East in one minute.

hook.text: Buddhism was born in India but became a giant in China. The Silk Road carried it there.

buildup.text: Monks walked the trade routes, setting up monasteries at oasis towns along the way.

discovery.text: Traders welcomed monks because monasteries offered safe lodging and honest dispute resolution.

twist.text: Buddhism changed as it traveled. Chinese Buddhism looks very different from Indian Buddhism.

climax.text: By the Tang Dynasty, Buddhism was China's dominant faith, shaping its art, law, and philosophy.

punchline.text: A religion spread not by armies but by merchants.

quiz.question: How did Buddhism primarily spread along the Silk Road?
